meanings.sent1: The candy had a liquorish flavor that reminded me of childhood.
meanings.sent2: The liquorish tea was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent3: The liquorish ice cream melted too quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The air was filled with the liquorish scent of the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The liquorish taste lingered on my tongue long after I finished the treat.

meanings.definition: Resembling liquorice in flavor or smell.
meanings.sent1: The dish had a liquorish aroma that made my mouth water.
meanings.sent2: The liquorish scent of the candle filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent3: The liquorish perfume was a unique choice for the event.
meanings.sent4: The liquorish flavor of the sauce added a special touch to the meal.
meanings.sent5: The liquorish smell of the bakery drew me in from down the street.

meanings.sent1: The liquorish candy had a strong, sweet taste.
meanings.sent2: The liquorish syrup gave the dessert a unique twist.
meanings.sent3: The liquorish drink was a refreshing choice on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The liquorish cookies were a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent5: The liquorish flavor of the dish surprised and delighted the guests.
